articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace successfully remodeled as required by the new century.
					 Feasting his eyes on the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, he said that the palace built to depict the care of the WPK under which the children live looked magnificent and very nice as its exterior was decorated with granite and high-quality building materials. The palace is the edifice which no other country can build or imitate and a monumental one demonstrating the advantageous socialist system in our country, he added.
					
					 He watched President Kim Il Sung's autographic proposition newly displayed in its lobby.
					
					 Noting that the meaningful proposition reflecting the President's noble outlook on the rising generation, future and revolution was prominently displayed with due respect, he said that reading every jewel-like word of the proposition, one can keenly realize how deeply the President loved the children.
					
					 He went round the newly arranged room for the education in the revolutionary history and the room which houses revolutionary relics.
					
					 The relics and mementoes that bear witness to the noble outlook of the President and leader Kim Jong Il on the younger generation and future are the precious treasures which should be handed down to posterity, he said, underscoring the need to effectively conduct the education of the officials, teachers and school youth and children through the immortal leadership exploits of the great leaders.
					
					 As the palace built under the loving care of the great leaders has been remodeled as required by the new century, he said he felt his heart ache at the thought that how happy children would have been, if they had given the New Year's eve performance in the presence of the great leaders.
					
					 He went round various places of the palace to learn in detail about its remodeling and preparations for its operation.
					
					 Noting that the science hall looked peculiar as it has a large relief Korean map and a model of a rocket for carrying satellite "Unha-3", etc, he praised the builders for successfully decorating the interior of the palace in such a way as to help school youth and children properly know about nature and geology of their country and nurture ambitious dreams and ideals to excel the world standard.
					
					 Saying that the palace is the comprehensive extracurricular education center for school youth and children of the country, he gave precious instructions which would serve as important guidelines for managing and operating the palace and took benevolent measures.
					
					 He noted that the remodeling of the palace was a very vast and difficult project, but the party spared nothing for it as it was an important one for preserving the bright smile and happiness of the children and their cheerful laughter meant hurrah for the final victory.
					
					 Now that the palace has been successfully remodeled, he proposed holding an inaugural ceremony with splendor. He gave an instruction concerning its inauguration.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Yang Gon, Ri Il Hwan, Jo Yong Won and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: WPK Central Committee Sends Congratulations to Supreme Council of United Russia Party
articles.content:
WPK Central Committee Sends Congratulations to Supreme Council of United Russia Party
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a congratulatory message to the Supreme Council of the United Russia Party Tuesday on its 14th birthday.
					 The message said the WPK has followed with great interest the activities of the United Russia Party to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country and build powerful Russia and has supported it.
					
					 Expressing the conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would grow stronger in the interests of the peoples of the DPRK and Russia under an agreement that has already been reached, the message wished the party bigger success in its activities.

articles.title: Greetings to Romanian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Romanian Foreign Minister
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Lazar Comanescu, foreign minister of Romania, on its national day.
					 The message expressed expectation and belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in conformity with desire and interests of the people of the two countries and wished him success in his new responsible work.

articles.title: Romanian Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Romanian Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Hosts Reception
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Gheorghe Cioaca, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Romanian embassy here, hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Tuesday on the occasion of the national day of Romania. 
					 Present there on invitation were Vice Foreign Minister Kung Sok Ung, Vice-Chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Kim Jin Bom, officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international bodies here. 
					
					 Staff members of the Romanian embassy were present at the reception.

articles.title: DPRK Military Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Military Delegation Back Home
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- A DPRK military delegation headed by Army General Pak Yong Sik, minister of the People's Armed Forces, came back home Tuesday after paying official goodwill visits to the Lao People's Democratic Republic and the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.

articles.title: Photo Exhibition Opens on National Day of Romania
articles.content:
Photo Exhibition Opens on National Day of Romania
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition was opened at the Chollima Hall of Culture Tuesday under the joint name of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, the Romanian embassy here and the DPRK-Romania Friendship Association on the occasion of the national day of Romania.
					 Present there were Vice-Chairman Ryu Kyong Il and members of the DPRK-Romania Friendship Association, officials concerned, people in the city, Gheorghe Cioaca, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Romanian embassy here, and his embassy officials.
					
					 Present there on invitation were foreign diplomatic envoys and embassy officials. 
					
					 The participants looked round photos on display there.

articles.title: Osandok Prize Sports Contest Opens
articles.content:
Osandok Prize Sports Contest Opens
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The Osandok prize sports contest opened with due ceremony at the Ice Rink on Tuesday.
					 The contest will be held in Pyongyang, Sariwon, Samjiyon and other places. Players will compete in football, ice hockey, speed skating, figure skating, short track speed skating and skiing games.
					
					 Present there were Vice-Premier of the Cabinet Ro Tu Chol, chairman of the State Planning Commission and vice-chairman of the State Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, officials concerned, sportspersons and working people. 
					
					 Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, made an opening address.
					
					 The opening ceremony was followed by men's ice hockey game between the Taesongsan Sports Team and the Pyongyang Railway Bureau Sports Team.

articles.title: World AIDS Day Marked in DPRK
articles.content:
World AIDS Day Marked in DPRK
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- An event took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday to mark World AIDS Day. 
					 Present at the event were officials in the field of public health, officials concerned, the representative of the WHO, the UN resident coordinator and UNDP resident representative in the DPRK and other members of the missions of the international bodies and foreign diplomatic envoys here.
					
					 Speakers said that many achievements have been made in different countries thanks to the dynamic work to reduce the number of victims of AIDS. 
					
					 They stressed the need for the healthcare field to steadily intensify hygienic information service and monitoring for preventing AIDS and prevent virus infection and spread. 
					
					 The event explained the world situation on AIDS and preventive measures against AIDS. Then followed a performance given by the hygienic information disseminating team of Sosong District People's Hospital. 
					
					 Meanwhile, information services for preventing AIDS were made at hygienic information halls in Pyongyang and all provinces on the same day.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Discloses U.S. Nature as World's Worst Human Rights Abuser
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Discloses U.S. Nature as World's Worst Human Rights Abuser
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. keeps trumpeting about "protection of human rights" only to be jeered by the world people.
					 It is because they are well aware of the inhuman nature of the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. keeps using the "human rights issue" as means for interference in the internal affairs of other countries and for regime changes there and a lever for world domination next to the nuclear stick.
					
					 A typical example is "Arab spring" that swept across North Africa and the Mideast region. 
					
					 The "Arab spring" is a "color revolution" which the U.S. engineered for the purpose of forcing other countries to accept American-style "democracy."
					
					 This brigandish "human rights" racket threw Libya, Yemen and many other countries in North Africa and the Mideast into extreme political chaos and the evil cycle of terrorism.
					
					 For the purpose of bringing Libya under its control, the U.S. has desperately conducted propaganda to create impression among Libyans that the U.S. is "genuine guardian of peace and human rights."
					
					 It put pressure on Libya to accept American-style "democracy" and give up everything and supported the anti-government forces while slandering the country as "human rights abuser" and "authoritarian state."
					
					 Finally in 2011 the U.S. carried out indiscriminate air raids by hurling its followers, reducing the country into debris.
					
					 The U.S. "human rights" campaign which promised "flower garden of freedom and democracy" resulted in the bloody massacre, overturn of social system and the death of more than 20,000. That was not all.
					
					 More than 5 000 big or small armed groups are now locked in fighting in Libya. Consequently, not a single day passes without bloody conflict and confrontation there.
					
					 The same is the case with Yemen, a country called "paradise of Arab" from the olden times for its favorable natural and geographical environment and rich natural resources.
					
					 Yemen was deprived of its sovereignty by the U.S. policy of escalating "war on terrorism" aimed at interference in the internal affair and has long been torn with discord and conflict among religious sects and political factions. Consequently, it turned into mayhem, swept by the wind of "Arab spring."
					
					 The political stability of the country has been disturbed, throwing the country into extreme chaos, disorder and evil cycle of terrorism.
					
					 This notwithstanding, the U.S. is mulling escalating brigandish political and military intervention worldwide under the pretext of "defending human rights" and "combating terrorism."
					
					 The U.S. is the world's biggest human rights abuser and a rogue state keen on interfering in the internal affairs of other countries and bringing down their social systems even by besmirching the sacred word human rights.
					
					 The U.S. is now working hard to make the DPRK a victim of its "human rights offensive". On Nov. 19 it cooked up "human rights resolution" against the DPRK even by abusing the UN arena.
					
					 The U.S. "human rights" racket targeting the DPRK is a conspiratorial move to bring down the socialist system, the life and soul of the Korean people.
					
					 It is a height of folly for the world's worst human rights abuser and the kingpin of human rights abuses to say this or that about the genuine human rights performance in the DPRK. It is more ridiculous for the U.S. to go reckless, unaware of who its rival is.
					
					 We have our own style socialist system centered on the popular masses which is envied by the world people and the single-minded unity of the army and people and the nuclear deterrence for self-defence which reliably protects everything valuable.
					
					 The U.S. despicable "human rights" farce being staged in different parts of the world will fail with the bankruptcy of its foolish anti- DPRK "human rights" racket as a momentum.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Rescission of SL in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Rescission of SL in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday carries an article on the lapse of 67 years since the fabrication of the "Security Law" (SL) in south Korea.
					 The SL was faked up on Dec. 1, 1948 by imitating the "Maintenance of the Public Order Act" of the Japanese imperialists under the pretext of preventing the "infiltration of communist forces".
					
					 It has served as a fascist law, being abused as a lever for preserving security of the "government" and maintaining dictatorial rule, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 Successive ruling quarters of south Korea did not bother perpetrating such evil doings against humanity as indiscriminate terrorism, murder and torture on the political dissidents opposed to the treacherous rule and innocent people by invoking the SL.
					
					 The bitter 67 year long history of the SL is the one of crimes against the nation and reunification in which democracy was strangled by dictatorship, treachery punished patriotism and injustice trampled down justice and conscience.
					
					 It is lamentable that the SL, which has stained with blood the history of the south Korean people's struggle for independence, democracy and reunification for decades, is still suppressing the truth, justice, progress and democracy.
					
					 The withdrawal of the SL is the task of the times that brooks no further delay.
					
					 It is impossible to put an end to the dictatorial rule in south Korea nor can its people realize their hope for independence, democracy and reunification as long as the SL remains in force.
					
					 The SL should be abrogated at once as it is standing in the way of independent and democratic development of society and reconciliation and unity of the nation.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Japan's Denial of Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Japan's Denial of Its Past Crimes
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Files of the Nanjing massacre perpetrated by the Imperial Japanese Army have been registered as UNESCO (memory of the world) documentary heritage. 
					 Concerning this, Japan is vociferous that an institutional reform should be carried out by the UNESCO and it is necessary to dispatch Japanese scholars to the advisory committee of the UNESCO.
					
					 Minju Joson on Tuesday comments in this regard:
					
					 This is a blatant challenge to the demand of the world people for Japan's settlement of its past crimes.
					
					 The massacre committed by the Japanese imperialists in Nanjing is still fresh in the memory of not only the Chinese people but also other Asian people as it was unprecedented in the history of humankind.
					
					 If Japan had a shred of conscience, it would have not dared protest the registration of the files of the massacre as the world documentary heritage.
					
					 By behaving quite contrary to this, Japan self-exposed before the world its deplorable moral level.
					
					 What is more ridiculous is that Japan threatened to take into consideration its contribution to the UNESCO, grumbling about the registration, That is to say, Japan will not pay contributions to the UNESCO in reprisal for the unpleasant registration. This is a shameful behavior of the morally depraved country.
					
					 Japan has not yet gotten rid of a fate as a political dwarf due to its failure to settle its part crimes though it is desperately working to increase its say and influence in international arena, advocating "international leadership."
					
					 Japan would be well advised to remember that it is a pressing task for Japan to redress its past crimes and make a right policy decision, though belatedly.

articles.title: Minju Joson Assails S. Korean Political Philistines' Moves to Railroad "Bill on Human Rights in North"
articles.content:
Minju Joson Assails S. Korean Political Philistines' Moves to Railroad "Bill on Human Rights in North"
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The political philistines of ruling and opposition parties of south Korea in a "meeting of floor leaders" on Nov. 24 decided to handle the "bill on human rights in the north" at the regular session of the "National Assembly" (NA). After the meeting, the floor leader of the "Saenuri Party" at the "joint meeting of leading officials" disclosed his undisguised ambition to railroad the "bill on human rights in the north," asserting that the "point in dispute with opposition parties was solved" and "lawmakers would handle it at the regular session of the NA come what may."
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The south Korean political philistines' desperate moves to railroad the "bill" are designed to realize their sinister intention to impair the ever rising dignity of the DPRK, bring down its social system and realize their ambition for achieving "unification of social systems." 
					
					 As already reported, the working-level contact for the talks between authorities of the north and the south of Korea took place in Panmunjom on Nov. 26 thanks to the positive measure and sincere efforts of the DPRK. At the contact, the both sides decided to hold the first round of the talks between authorities of the north and the south in Kaesong Industrial Zone on December 11 and discuss the pending issues for the improvement of the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 It was against this backdrop that the south Korean political philistines blustered that they would railroad the "bill" at any cost on the eve of the working-level contact. This brought to light once again the confrontational posture of the present conservative ruling forces who are displeased with the improvement of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are loud-mouthed about the "bill" not because of any interest in someone's "issue of human rights" but because of their pursuance of their sinister aim to stifle it at any cost.

articles.title: S. Korean People Denounce Authorities' Labor Market Restructuring
articles.content:
S. Korean People Denounce Authorities' Labor Market Restructuring
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- There is widespread protests against the labor market restructuring in south Korea, according to the south Korean paper Media Today.
					 From Oct. 7 to Nov. 25, there took place a referendum related to the present regime's labor market restructuring in more than 160 cities, counties and districts across south Korea including Seoul and Jeju Island.
					
					 In the referendum held under the theme "Is the regime's labor policy reform or disaster", 96 percent of the participants held that this is the retrogressive revision of labor law.

articles.title: Kwangju Headquarters of KCTU Calls on People to Turn out in Second All-out People's Action
articles.content:
Kwangju Headquarters of KCTU Calls on People to Turn out in Second All-out People's Action
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The Kwangju headquarters of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) held a meeting in Kwangju on November 27 to call upon people to turn out in the second all-out people's action, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People. 
					 At the end of the meeting the participants held a demonstration march denouncing the authorities' murderous suppression of the all-out people's action and appealing to citizens to turn out in the second all-out people's action.

articles.title: U.S. Denounced for Dividing Korean Nation
articles.content:
U.S. Denounced for Dividing Korean Nation
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Minjok Thongsin, an internet paper of Koreans in the U.S., on November 29 carried an article of a Korean critic who lives in the U.S.
					 The critic denounced the U.S. for dividing the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The article said that the U.S. connived at Japan's occupation of Korea and encouraged it, making Korea to be under the cruel rule of the Japanese imperialists for decades.
					
					 The article went on:
					
					 It divided Korea when the Japanese imperialists were defeated and broke its word that it will withdraw from Korea when the military operation is finished. Washington has since stationed its military troops in south Korea, claiming it would defend south Korea from the north's military threat.
					
					 The U.S. ignited the Korean war on June 25, 1950 for its military interest.
					
					 The U.S. is responsible for dividing Korean Peninsula, plunging it into the bloodbath of war and making the Korean nation live with the pain of division.
					
					 It is a shame of the Korean nation that south Korea regards the U.S. as its master, while calling it a "liberator" and "savior".
					
					 We can not but question those who do not think the U.S. division of Korean Peninsula as the Korean nation's misfortune for whom the U.S. is keeping its forces in south Korea.
					
					 The Korean nation's wish is reunification night and day, the article said.

articles.title: Koreans in China Lambaste S. Korean Authorities' Distortion of History
articles.content:
Koreans in China Lambaste S. Korean Authorities' Distortion of History
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China on Nov. 27 made public a statement lambasting the south Korean conservative forces' moves to tamper with history.
					 The statement said:
					
					 All Koreans in the north, the south and abroad can't repress their towering resentment at the south Korean conservative group's projected introduction of "state-compiled" history textbook.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are seeking a sinister political motive in introducing the "state-compiled" history textbook to justify the pro-Japanese acts and "yusin" dictatorship and embellish the military coup staged by the Park Chung-hee regime.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is the fact that the authorities brutally suppressed the members of the civic bodies and people from all walks of life, who staged demonstrations in protest against the above-said textbook, by hurling riot police. 
					
					 The General Association of Koreans in China in its statement voiced support and solidarity with the compatriots in the south in their anti-"government" action to check the introduction of above-said textbook. 
					
					 The General Association of Koreans in China and all the Koreans in China will turn out as one in the struggle to frustrate the south Korean authorities' politically motivated moves for introducing "state-compiled" textbook, declared the statement.

articles.title: Rally for Solidarity with DPRK Held in Venezuela
articles.content:
Rally for Solidarity with DPRK Held in Venezuela
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- A rally for solidarity with the DPRK took place in Venezuela on Nov. 18.
					 Present there on invitation were personages of the Communist Party of Venezuela, the United Socialist Party of Venezuela, the Communist Youth of Venezuela and other youth organizations, the Communist Party of Chile and other political parties and organizations of various countries and other people, the DPRK ambassador to that country and officials of the embassy and the delegation of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League visiting Venezuela.
					
					 The international secretary of the Communist Party of Venezuela said that the people of progressive countries of the world including Venezuela extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their drive to defend sovereignty against the imperialists and achieve the reunification of the country, and to the DPRK government in its efforts to replace the Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty.
					
					 The general secretary of the Communist Youth of Venezuela said the efforts of the Korean people and youths for building socialism against imperialism are an example to the people and youths of Venezuela.
					
					 The international secretary of the youth organization of the United Socialist Party of Venezuela stressed he would strive hard to boost support, solidarity and unity among the youths of the two countries in the struggle against their common enemy the U.S. imperialists.

articles.title: Committee for Remembering Kim Jong Il Formed in Russia
articles.content:
Committee for Remembering Kim Jong Il Formed in Russia
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The committee for remembering Comrade Kim Jong Il was formed in the Maritime Territory branch of the Youth Guards under the United Russia Party, on Nov. 26.
					 Head of the branch Ragunov was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to conduct political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il among youths in the maritime territory on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Swedish Committee for Remembering Kim Jong Il Formed
articles.content:
Swedish Committee for Remembering Kim Jong Il Formed
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The Swedish committee for remembering great Comrade Kim Jong Il was formed on Nov. 23. 
					Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, the international secretary of the Communist Party of Sweden and the executive member of the Goteborg Committee of the Communist Party of Sweden were elected co-chairmen of the remembrance committee. 
					
					The committee decided to organize political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Pakistan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Pakistan
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- A Pakistani national committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Karachi on November 23.
					 Amar Jit, former senator of Pakistan, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events praising the exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Events Marking Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Held in Various Countries
articles.content:
Events Marking Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Held in Various Countries
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries to mark the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 A seminar and round-table talks took place in Kinshasa of DR Congo, a reading session in Cotonou, Benin and a film show in Lagos, Nigeria from Nov. 15 to 19.
					
					 The chairman of the Democratic Congolese committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il said that Kim Jong Il energetically worked for the accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche started by President Kim Il Sung, thus making great contributions to the Korean revolution and the accomplishment of the cause of global independence.
					
					 The chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association praised the undying feats performed by Kim Jong Il for the accomplishment of the human cause of independence, adding the prospering DPRK would have been unthinkable apart from the outstanding leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chief of the Beninese group for the study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism said Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il was a peerless Songun commander who was possessed of outstanding military wisdom and superb stratagem just like Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, primero de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio el Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae, reconstruido maravillosamente de acuerdo con la demanda del nuevo siglo.
					Contemplando el panorama del palacio, el Mariscal dijo que la figura del palacio es tan majestuosa y vistosa por haber decorado con los granitos y los materiales de construccion de buena calidad el exterior del palacio que describe el regazo de nuestro partido donde crecen los ninos. Prosiguio que el Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae es un edificio arquitectonico que otros paises no pueden tenerlo ni imitarlo y que ostenta la superioridad del regimen socialista de nuestro pais.
					
					El Mariscal vio la escritura autografa del Presidente Kim Il Sung colocada nuevamente en el hall de la entrada del palacio.
					
					Recalco que se ha colocado clara y cortesmente el autografo del Presidente en que esta reflejada su noble concepcion de las generaciones venideras, el porvenir y la revolucion. Anadio que al leer una tras otra esa escritura se puede experimentar el gran amor del Presidente por los ninos.
					
					El Mariscal paso revista a la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria y la sala de conservacion de objetos historicos revolucionarios, acondicionadas nuevamente en el palacio.
					
					Los objetos y datos historicos alusivos al noble amor del Presidente y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il por las generaciones venideras y el futuro son valiosos patrimonios a ser transmitidos generacion tras generacion, acoto y destaco la necesidad de hacer bien entre los funcionarios, maestros y ninos escolares del palacio la educacion mediante las inmortales hazanas de direccion de los grandes lideres antecesores.
					
					Prosiguio que al ver el palacio levantado por el gran amor del Presidente y el Dirigente y remodelado conforme a la demanda del nuevo siglo, le toca el corazon el pensamiento de que seria muy alegre si ofrecieran la funcion del Ano Nuevo bajo la presencia del Presidente y el Dirigente. 
					
					Al recorrer varios lugares del palacio, se entero en detalles del estado de reconstruccion y los preparativos para la gestion. 
					
					Senalo que es peculiar el hall cientifico en que estan instalados la gran maqueta de mapa coreano y el modelo de "Unha-3", cohete transportador de satelite artificial de la Tierra. Continuo que han decorado bien el hall dando a los escolares y ninos el ambicioso sueno e ideal de conocer correctamente la naturaleza y la geografia de la patria y alcanzar el nivel mundial. 
					
					El Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae es la base integral de educacion extraescolar para nuestros escolares y ninos, dijo y dio valiosas instrucciones que sirven de guia programatica en la gestion del palacio y tomo las medidas benevolentes 
					
					Subrayo que aunque la reconstruccion del palacio fue una obra tan inmensa y dificil, el partido no escatimo nada porque esa obra es la labor importantisima para defender la clara risa y felicidad de los ninos y llevar las risas de hoy de los ninos a los vitores de la victoria final.
					
					Insistio en realizar solemnemente la ceremonia inaugural y dio la orden referente a la inauguracion.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Kim Yang Gon, Ri Il Hwan, Jo Yong Won y Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena locuras de politiqueros surcoreanos
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena locuras de politiqueros surcoreanos
Pyongyang, primero de diciembre (ACNC) -- El dia 24 de noviembre, los politiqueros del partido gobernante y los opositores del Sur de Corea acordaron en una "reunion entre direcciones parlamentarias" aprobar la "ley de DDHH del Norte (de Corea)" en la presente periodica "Asamblea Nacional". Tras el encuentro, el representante parlamentario del "Partido Saenuri" lanzo disparates en la "conferencia conjunta de altos funcionarios prominentes" que "eliminaron los puntos litigantes junto con los partidos opositores" y "segun el acuerdo la aprobaran sin falta en la periodica 'Asamblea Nacional'", asi que demostro abiertamente la intencion de adoptar a fuerza la "ley de DDHH del Norte".
					El periodico Minju Joson, en un comentario individual divulgado el dia primero, senala que los politiqueros surcoreanos se desesperan por aprobarla para manchar la dignidad de la RPDC, derrumbar a toda costa su regimen y realizar la ambicion de la "unificacion mediante la fusion de regimenes" y continua:
					
					Como ya se informo, tuvo lugar el dia 26 de noviembre en Phanmunjom el contacto de trabajo para las conversaciones entre las autoridades del Norte y el Sur segun nuestra medida iniciativa y esfuerzo sincero. En la ocasion, el Norte y el Sur acordaron efectuar el 11 de diciembre en la Zona Industrial de Kaesong las primeras conversaciones de autoridades Norte-Sur y debatir los problemas inmediatos para la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Precisamente en vispera del contacto de trabajo, los politicastros surcoreanos tratan de aprobar la "ley de DDHH del Norte", lo cual revela de nuevo a todo el mundo el caracter conflictivo de las actuales fuerzas gobernantes conservadoras que no estan contentos con la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					La actitud de las autoridades surcoreanas solamente comprueba que ellos nunca tienen interes en el "problema de DDHH" de alguien sino persiguen el proposito maligno para aplastar a toda costa la RPDC.

articles.title: Minju Joson refuta la intencion de Japon de negar la historia llena de crimenes
articles.content:
Minju Joson refuta la intencion de Japon de negar la historia llena de crimenes
Pyongyang, primero de diciembre (ACNC) -- Inmediatamente despues de ser registrados como patrimonio de memoria del mundo de la Organizacion de las Naciones Unidas para la Educacion, la Ciencia y la Cultura (UNESCO) los datos relativos a la gran masacre en Nanjing perpetrada en el pasado por los imperialistas japoneses, Japon dice que la "UNESCO debe realizar la reforma institucional" y "hay que enviar los sabios japoneses al comite de examen de la UNESCO".
					Estas insistencias de Japon constituyen el desafio frontal a la opinion publica internacional que le exige la liquidacion del pasado.
					
					Asi insiste el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual divulgado el dia primero y continua:
					
					La masacre en Nanjing es el caso nunca visto en la historia de la humanidad y la recuerdan todavia el pueblo chino y los asiaticos.
					
					Si Japon tiene un pedacito de conciencia, no podria intentar una protesta el registro de su crimen como patrimonio de memoria del mundo.
					
					La actitud de Japon demuestra a todo el mundo su nivel moral muy bajo.
					
					Lo que no se puede pasar por alto es que cuestionando este trabajo de registro Japon habla de la necesidad de repensar el problema de la donacion de dineros asignados a la organizacion internacional. Es decir, quiere hacer represalias con la suspension del dinero asignado.
					
					Es una conducta de un imbecil.
					
					Aunque Japon intenta elevar el derecho a la palabra y la influencia en las escenas internacionales, hablando de la "capacidad directiva internacional", no se libera de la situacion miserable de enano politico por el problema de la liquidacion del pasado.
					
					Japon debe saber claramente que la liquidacion del pasado es una tarea inminente y tomar la correcta determinacion politica.
